main_definition: in a manner that is entirely accurate, complete, or without any flaws.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Without any mistakes or faults; completely accurate.
meanings_and_examples.example: She answered the questions perfectly in her interview.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In an exceptionally good or commendable manner.
meanings_and_examples.example: The chef cooked the steak perfectly, with just the right amount of seasoning and doneness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fully and completely; leaving nothing to be desired.
meanings_and_examples.example: He finished his work perfectly, meeting all deadlines without compromising quality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To the highest degree or standard of excellence.
meanings_and_examples.example: The team's performance was perfect during their winning streak.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a way that shows no sign of imperfection; flawless.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her rendition of the song was perfectly pitched, with impeccable timing and expression.
